alert.note: Alert for Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 4:31PM CDT until April 05 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Williamson County in Middle Tennessee... * Until 500 PM CDT. * At 431 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Franklin, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Franklin, Brentwood, Nolensville and Thompson`s Station. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 59 and 69. Interstate 840 between mile markers 27 and 31. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
